cyclone.name: JERRY
cyclone.trajectory: Turning north, then north-northeast and northeast while passing just west of Bermuda and then accelerating into the open North Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Closest approach to Bermuda (no direct mainland landfall expected)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Leeward Islands and Puerto Rico coasts experiencing long-period swells and rip-currents
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: None listed (San Juan not in wind-probability table)
weather_observation.wind: No tropical-storm-force winds expected at San Juan; only locally breezy trade-wind conditions
weather_observation.rainfall: Brief showers possible; widespread heavy rainfall not anticipated
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents along exposed beaches created by long-period swells from Jerry
